item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "We need enormous pockets, pockets big enough for our families and our friends, and even the people who aren't on our lists, people we've never met but still want to protect. We need pockets for boroughs and for cities, a pocket that could hold the universe." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Caroline add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "… People have (with the help of conventions) oriented all their solutions toward the easy and toward the easiest side of the easy; but it is clear that we must hold to what is difficult; everything in Nature grows and defends itself in its own way and is characteristically and spontaneously itself, seeks at all costs to be so and against all opposition. —Rainer Maria Rilke, Letters to a Young Poet" -- Alice Walker
